Records say 'Whitey' acted as informant as early as '50s

When James "Whitey" Bulger grew from small crimes to bank robbery, he gave up his accomplices, which may be how he learned to use the FBI. (Globe, 1:40 p.m.)
  • Special The capture of 'Whitey'  |  Bulger in exile

Haverhill teen accused of causing fatal crash says he was not texting

Aaron Deveau, who is accused of causing a fatal 2011 crash, said he was trying to avoid rear-ending a car and not texting when his car swerved. (Globe, 1:37 p.m.)
Catching up with old Red Sox friends

Pictures: Manny being... 40

Manny Ramirez turns 40 today, and he's also set to debut with the Athletics after a 50-game suspension. Catch up with him and other former Red Sox players.

More Red Sox coverage

MBTA continues to see strong ridership

Ridership averaged more than 1.3 million per weekday in April, the third straight month that number has been above 1.3 million, the agency said. (Globe, 11:47 a.m.)
  • MBTA changes to expect | quiz Which MBTA line are you?

Nursing homes pushed to reduce antipsychotic drug use by 15% this year

Almost 40 percent of nursing home residents with signs of dementia received antipsychotics in 2010, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services said. (Globe, 12:01 p.m.)
  • Senators push for consent before use of antipsychotics
  • Special Report Antipsychotics used to pacify elderly

Romney misspells 'America' on app

A day that began questioning whether the president was born in America ended with questions about whether Mitt Romney can spell America. (Globe, 11:06 a.m.)

Man killed in I-95 incident in Boxford ID'd
